TopicTitle: How do I move SPH craft?

Articles.Content: How do I move he SPH craft to the VAB without the weird symmetry glitchyness?
Copy the .craft file from /KSP/saves/YourSaveName/SPH/ to /KSP/saves/YourSaveName/VAB/, then edit the new .craft file and change the SPH entry to VAB.

Even if you change the building to be the proper type in the file, you still get odd symmetry. Not sure what can be done about that. I just deal with it, as is.

The alternative is to achieve what you want in the same building. For example you can build a mirror symmetry rocket around whatever you have in the SPH, and just rotate it upright and slap some launch clamps on it.

I recommend EditorTools, it allows to change symmentry mode while building and choose launchpad or runway for launching.

And it has more awesome building features.
The DL for that was removed for "copyright issues" because of the lack of a license.

you can't download it from there (or anywhere i am aware) because of the recent nuke of all community made deadbeef mod patches to bring them up to speed with the new versions of the game. this is because of copyright issues, where deadbeef's licences prohibited others from working on his stuff without express permission.
Would it be ok if I upload EdTools to my Dropbox and send links over pm?
Oh, so I hope no one will ask me for that, lol.
If you start the craft in the desired hangar (VAB), move it to the SPH, do your business, then move it back. It might work? Good luck. I'm in a good mood so have a good day too.

What are you people doing?!

YOU DON'T NEED TOOLS!

Each craft has a specific mode. To change it, open the files that look like notepads with notepad (irony) where it says file type SPH, change it to VAB.

Easy!

Then transfer your craft over to the file named VAB!
You don't even need to leave the game to do it Rhyunix' way.
